p: Another pathway of vasorelaxation endothelium-dependent has been studied; itâ€™s about the COX product: PGI 2 which is recognized for its potential ability to relax vascular smooth muscle [ 90] via activation of second messenger cAMP [ 91]. Hence, the possible role of PGI 2 seems to be ruled out, because the pretreatment of aorta with, indomethacin, the COX inhibitor, did not change the vasorelaxant effect induced by AcEO.
